author: _shemnon
content: I think a strict prohibition on additional fields will push the RPC standard to calcify earlier than is healthy.  There needs to be a way to add in-development and experimental data for future evolution.  It also makes it difficult for clients (both EL and CL) to provide value-added features outside of the engine pairing.  "revert reason" is an excellent example of this, a critical value add to end users but not a standard field in transaction receipts.

author: _shemnon
content: I was going to propose that all non-standard and experimental fields start with `X` or `X-` but that is now frowned upon by the IETF - https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6648.html#appendix-B
